p: In the absence of competition, the biomass of C. stoebe differed significantly among the three geo-cytotypes (F 2, 24 = 6.21, P = 0.01; Fig 2b). Specifically, the biomass of EU2x C. stoebe was lower than that of EU4x and NA4x C. stoebe (Tukey’s HSD, P = 0.002 & P = 0.01, respectively), while no difference was found between the two 4x C. stoebe (Tukey’s HSD, P = 0.39; Fig 2b). Percent flowering of C. stoebe also significantly differed among the three geo-cytotypes (Resid. Deviance = 4.72, F = 3.84, P = 0.04, Fig 2c), with that of EU 2x C. stoebe being lower than that of the 4x C. stoebe (Tukey Contrasts, P = 0.01 & P = 0.04, respectively; Fig 2c). No difference was found between EU4x and NA4x C. stoebe (Tukey Contrasts, P = 0.82, Fig 2c).
